DOC.HEAD: Summary of Events
Eds: Updates with additional troops being sent, Thurman comment, 21 American soldiers killed.
DOC.TEXT: Here is a brief summary of events in Panama: _Supporters of Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega fired mortars and attacked buildings near the U.S. Southern Command. The fighting lasted about an hour. Sporadic fighting and sniper fire continued in many areas of Panama City. _A Pentagon source said an additional 2,000 Army soldiers would be flown to Panama to supplement the 24,000 already in the country. _Noriega loyalists tried to assassinate the Panamanian vice president installed by the United States. He was not injured. _Several pro-Noriega bands surrendered in western Panama. _Gen. Maxwell Thurman, chief of the U.S. Southern Command, said until Noriega is captured he will be a ``guiding hand'' behind resistance to the U.S. occupation. _American forces rescued a Smithsonian Institution research team abducted by Noriega soldiers. _Looters ransacked stores for the third day. Refugees fleeing the fighting took cover in soccer stadiums, churches and schools. _President Bush told Congress it was impossible to predict the ``scope and duration'' of the U.S. intervention. _The Organization of American States said in Washington it ``deeply deplored'' the invasion and called for withdrawal of American forces. _Twenty-one American troops and two female dependents have been killed, 202 wounded and two soldiers and one civilian are missing. U.S. officials said 122 Panamanian soldiers were killed and 45 wounded. Hospital officials said they believed half the Panamanian casualties were civilian.
